value.title: Can an Artificial Intelligence Be Ethical? Researchers Asked AI, and It Sees Both Sides
value.excerpt: A team of researchers asked an artificial intelligence program whether or not it can be ethical! And it turns out AI ethics might depend on us.

value.excerpt: Discrete and continuous manufacturing lines generate a high volume of products at low latency, ranging from milliseconds to a few seconds. value.title: Mohammed bin Rashid honours 240 graduates of the ‘Artificial Intelligence Programme’
value.excerpt: Dubai: His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President and Prime Minister of the UAE and Ruler of Dubai, honoured the graduates of the second and third batches of the ‘Artificial Intelligence Programme’ organised by the National Programme for Artificial Intelligence and the Kellogg College - University of Oxford.

value.title: Machine Learning Trends for Marketers to Watch in 2022
value.excerpt: Machine learning and AI research are making strides daily, with interesting implications for business. While it feels like a lot of the cool innovations are happening only in the scientific fields, progress can be seen in the marketing discipline too.

value.title: Unique closes $6M Seed for its AI-driven video calls platform aimed at sales teams

value.title: The US-China Technology Arms Race. It’s Not A Two-Country Race Anymore.
value.excerpt: The global technology arms race is no longer a race among a few countries, especially the US and China. It's expanded, and includes a large number of countries all vying for competitive advantage. The US — one of the major players — must double down on its technology investment strategy — or lose.

value.title: MediaTek’s Flagship Dimensity 9000 SoC Isn’t The Company’s Only Interesting New Chip
value.excerpt: A few weeks ago at its Executive Summit in Laguna Beach, CA, MediaTek announced its first foray into the SoC market: the Dimensity 9000. The company’s first 4nm chip from TSMC features a multitude of flagship-worthy features that make it competitive with what’s already available in the market today.

value.excerpt: Psychologists use mazes to assess the learning capacity of mice or rats. But how about robots? Can they learn to navigate the twists and turns of a labyrinth? value.title: How Ethical Hackers Could Help Us Build Trust in AI
value.excerpt: Governments are increasingly mandating reporting of data breaches and hacks; the same could apply to incidents where AI systems cause harm.

value.title: Podcastle Makes Creating Podcasts Easy Thanks To Ai Technology

value.title: Why All Companies Must Explore The Role Of Ethics In Technology
value.excerpt: The savviest companies must learn to understand and embrace the nuances at the intersection between technology and human values.

value.title: Polymer lands $4M to bring no-code data loss prevention to SaaS apps
value.excerpt: Polymer says its no-code platform enables automated data loss prevention (DLP) for SaaS apps, including Microsoft Teams and Google Drive.

value.title: Outsmarting AI To Be The Grandmaster Of Your Industry
value.excerpt: Tactically, your organization and its business processes may not be able to outperform your competitors’ AI and data-driven approaches. But for the foreseeable future, strategically outlasting them move-for-move until they waiver remains a viable strategy.

value.title: Human-Computer Communication: How Businesses Are Using Natural Language Processing To Talk To Data
value.excerpt: Today's business users rely on a collection of reports and dashboards to better understand the data underlying their operations. These tools are most often designed by IT organizations, which use coding languages like SQL to ask questions of their database and report the findings back to business users.

value.title: Why Are Tesla’s Self Driving Software Sales Slowing Down?
value.excerpt: Firstly, Tesla has been increasingly emphasizing its Model 3 and Y vehicles, which have a lower starting price and this could be reducing attach rates for the self-driving package, which is likely a more popular option on higher-end cars.

value.title: Deepfake anyone? AI synthetic media tech enters perilous phase

value.title: Samsung promotes robotics as future growth driver
value.excerpt: Samsung Electronics Co. named its newly merged unit for mobile and appliances the device experience (DX) division, the company has said, in a sign of its resolve to provide its customers with new, meaningful experiences.

value.title: S.Korea to test AI-powered facial recognition to track COVID-19 cases
value.excerpt: South Korea will soon roll out a pilot project to use artificial intelligence, facial recognition and thousands of CCTV cameras to track the movement of people infected with the coronavirus, despite concerns about the invasion of privacy.

value.title: Clearview AI Has Acquired A New Patent For Facial Recognition Technology
value.excerpt: Advertisement Clearview AI has developed a facial recognition technology that might have spotted you by now. The company’s software skims through public images that are available on social media and uses them to help law enforcement identify wanted individuals by matching their public images with those found in government databases or surveillance footage.

value.title: Next-gen GPU’s from AMD to contain a stacked accelerator die
value.excerpt: If it can assist enhance performance, it's an intriguing technology that we'd like to see included in our gaming GPUs.

value.title: Digital Diplomacy: AI As A Tool To Strengthen International Relations
value.excerpt: Steady international relations are necessary to maintain world peace and a stable global financial market. However, diplomacy should ideally also bridge the gap between the wealthy and poor countries.
